pages.content: Miko| has| a| close| friend| – Big| Bear.| Every| day,| when| Miko| goes| to| bed,| she| always| puts| Big| Bear| next| to| her.| In| Miko’s| mind,| Big| Bear| is| her| bodyguard.

One| night| before| bedtime,| Mom| looks| at| Big| Bear.| She| turns| to| Miko.
“Big| Bear| is| lying| here,| so| where| should| Mom| lie| now?”| She| asks.
“Mom,| you| should| pick| Big| Bear| up,| then| you| lie| down| beside| me,”|  says| Miko| innocently.

“Doesn’t| Miko| love| Big| Bear?”|  Mom| wonders. 
“Yes,| Mom,| I| love| Big| Bear,”| Miko| replies| quickly.| “But| I| love| you| more.” 
“How| much| do| you| love| Big| Bear,| Miko?”| 
“This| much,| Mom!”.| Miko| wraps| her| arms| around| her| chest| to| form| a| circle.| Little| Miko| grins| brightly.

Mom| winks| and| smiles| happily. 
She| asks,| “Well,| so| Miko,| how| much| do| you| love| me?” 
After| thinking| a| while,| Miko| replies,  
“Tomorrow| morning,| I| will| give| you| the| answer.”
Mom| wishes| Miko| good| night| and| gives| a| kiss| on| her| forehead.

Next| morning,| Miko| wakes| up| and| runs| to| Mom’s| room.| Miko| hugs| her| Mom| from| behind. 
“Mom,| mom!| I| know| how| much| I| love| you!”| Miko| delights.

“My| love| for| Mom| is| as| big| as| my| tummy!”|  Miko| points| at| her| tummy. 
“But| your| tummy| can| hold| only| a| bowl| of| rice,| how| can| you| love| Mom| so| much?”| Mom| asks.
“No,| Mom,| no!”| Miko| quickly| answers.| “My| tummy| can| hold| a| whole| elephant!| My| love| for| you| is| as| big| as| a| whole| elephant! -

“Well,| let| me| see| how| big| Miko’s| tummy| is!”| Mom| winks| playfully.
Then,| Mom| rubs| Miko’s| tummy| and| tickles| it.| This| makes| Miko| laugh| out| loud!
